name: GassFlow
short_description:
GassFlow

GassFlow means Genome Annotation based on Species Similarity,which targets to offer a computational method for genome annotation through similar species that the genome sequences are well annotated.

Usage

The gassflow offers two options of running mode, one is workflow running mode, whose whole running is managed with Pegasus; and another is simple shell running mode, allows users to implement each branch of analysis with one unix command. Check unix-mode manual and workflow manual for more detail.

Citation

Please cite our publication in the Bioinformatics journal

Download

    All of our source codes can be downloaded from Google Drive.
    Our related reference file can be download from here 

Development Team

    The source codes and Unix running mode of GassFlow were developed by Ying Wang's group, Automation Department, Xiamen University,China. All suggestions are welcomed to ying.wang.usc AT gmail.com or NealSong1990 AT gmail.com.
summary: This is a Computational Method for Genome Annotation based on Species
